thread.title: H.S. girls volleyball roundup: Ridgewood opens Bergen County tournament with win
thread.title_full: H.S. girls volleyball roundup: Ridgewood opens Bergen County tournament with win

title: H.S. girls volleyball roundup: Ridgewood opens Bergen County tournament with win
text:
Print 
LEONIA – Better decisions led to fewer lapses and that carried Ridgewood to a dominating performance in the first round of the 41st Bergen County girls volleyball tourney. 
“That was probably the most consistent match we’ve played all year,” coach Ron Knott said Saturday after the 18th-seeded Maroons defeated previously unbeaten and No. 15 Leonia, 25-21, 25-14. 
The victory by Ridgewood (7-8) got it closer to the .500 required record to secure a state tournament bid by Wednesday’s cutout. 
Ridgewood (7-8) quickly gained control in each set to earn a victory desperately needed to reach the minimum .500 record required to secure a state tournament bid by Wednesday’s cutoff. 
The Maroons scored the first four points and had four runs of four or more points. Senior Brittany Gilbert opened with a kill en route to a team-high 11 and added five digs. 
Ridgewood competes in arguably, top to bottom, the most competitive division in the state, the Big North Freedom. The Maroons’ steady blocking and digging led the NJIC Liberty Division leaders to commit an uncharacteristically high number of errors. 
“The struggle was we just don’t face that kind of competition on a regular basis,” Leonia coach Steven Corn said., “and we gave up groups of points in each game.” 
In other first-round matches: 
GLEN ROCK 2, PASCACK VALLEY 1 (at Hillsdale): The No. 20 Panthers (16-5) were the lowest seed to advance. Junior hitter Lizzie Alba had team highs in 13 kills and 25 digs and senior setter Killeen McDonald 26 assists and 17 digs in a 25-15, 21-25, 25-22 win. 
NO. HIGHLANDS 2, BECTON 0 (at E. Rutherford): Senior hitter Calla Dulmage had team highs of six kills and nine digs as the No. 17 Highlanders (10-8) prevailed, 25-21, 25-20. 
HOLY ANGELS 2, BERGEN TECH 0 (at Demarest): The No. 14 Angels (11-5) won 25-21, 25-7 with seniors Lauren Dickerson (8 kills) and Jamie Rizzo (17 assists). 
FAIR LAWN 2, MIDLAND PARK 0 (at Fair Lawn): Senior Jenna Berry had nine kills and sophomore Raina Alexander 15 assists in a 25-17, 25-13 win by No. 12 FH (15-5). 
RAMAPO 2, SADDLE BROOK 0 (at Franklin Lakes): Sophomore hitter Elena Montgomery had seven kills and three digs as the No. 11 Green Raiders (12-4) won, 25-6, 25-15. 
RUTHERFORD 2, HACKENSACK 0 (at Rutherford): Senior middle Jessica Rogers had 20 kills to pace the No. 10 Bulldogs (14-4) to the 25-14, 25-9 victory. 
BOGOTA 2, GARFIELD 0 (at Bogota): Junior setter Samantha Gioiosa had 14 kills and senior setter Amanda Manzo 22 assists for the No. 9 Bucs (16-2) in the 25-11, 25-7 win. 
MAHWAH 2, LYNDHURST 0 (at Mahwah): Junior middle Tabitha Paul had 13 kills and senior Britni Jaskot 17 assists as the No. 8 T-Birds (15-3) secured a 25-15, 25-13 win. 
PASCACK HILLS 2, CRESSKILL 0 (at Montvale): Senior libero Jamie Spelling had 17 digs to pace the No. 7 Cowgirls (13-2) to the 25-14, 25-13 victory. 
TENAFLY 2, FORT LEE (at Tenafly): Senior hitter Noy Chorin had eight kills and senior setter Anna Stein 13 assists for the No. 6 Tigers (16-4) in a 25-15, 25-15 win. 
NV/DEMAREST 2, DUMONT 0 (at Demarest): Senior Faith Hoagland had 20 assists in a 25-13, 25-12 win by the No. 5 Norsewomen (14-2). 
PARAMUS 2, WALLINGTON 0 (at Paramus): Senior Maria Bellinger had 14 kills as the No. 4 Spartans (15-3) won, 25-5, 25-5. 
RIVER DELL 2, CLIFFSIDE PARK 0 (at Oradell): Juniors Grace Kelly (10 kills) and Meredith Arancio (19 assists) led the No. 3 Golden Hawks (16-0) in a 25-13, 25-2 win.
